volunteer_experiences.description: I work as a volunteer for a German organization called VJF set in Berlin. I organized and coordinated international trips for foreign students in Germany, according to the European voluntary civil service. I coordinated and participated in 4 different project spread around Germany. The projects were mostly focused on environment safeguarding.

In 2015 I joined Enactus, which is a student international non-profit organization dedicated to enabling progress through entrepreneurial action. Enactus counts 66.500 members in 36 countries worldwide. Enactus provides a platform for university students to collaborate with business and academic leaders in the development of entrepreneurial-based projects that empower people to transform opportunities into real, sustainable progress for themselves and their communities. Specifically I am working on a project called "green canteen" which aims at deliver a better catering service to students integrating elderly people from the community of Maastircht.

The CIP Institute is a non-profit membership organization that gathers scientists and practitioners across disciplines to exchange and develop knowledge in the field of risk and crisis. I worked in a team to create a sharing platform to enable the CIP institute to map, store and retrieve members’ knowledge and to facilitate the sharing of knowledge.

Achievements: results were presented at the 2nd international CIP conference, held in Amsterdam on the 3rd of July 2015. The results were a report that combined theoretical and practical steps to map, store and retrieve CIP member’s knowledge.
